text.text: We were very lucky to have a wonderful museum tour guide that was very knowledgeable and happy to tell us many interesting stories that connected the dots for us across cultures and religions in this region through history. My 10 year old also enjoyed the tour and exhibits. We felt like everything was clarified for us and made much more sense. Thank You so much!

text.text:
Cool place to spend a lazy afternoon. Learn some historical facts and admire ancient crafts.
There's a VR experience and some activities like blocks building , and paper crafts. It's sparkling clean! Free for locals too! Will visit again when there's a new theme.

text.text: In my opinion, this Asia Civilisations museum venue is truly underrated. However, if you have an interest in ceramics, Asian history, or related topics, you'll find it to be an exceptionally educational museum. The exhibits are thoughtfully curated, providing deep insights into the rich cultural heritage and historical significance of the artifacts on display. Visitors are encouraged to take their time, thoroughly read the information provided, and explore the museum at a leisurely pace. The experience is both enlightening and enriching, making it well worth the visit. Whether you're a history enthusiast or simply curious about the past, this museum offers a fascinating journey through time and culture.

text.text:
The Asian Civilisations Museum offers a captivating journey into Asia’s rich cultural tapestry. Housed in a stately historical building along the Singapore River, the museum provides visitors with an impressive collection of artifacts spanning centuries and a multitude of civilizations.

From intricately carved stone sculptures to delicate porcelain, the museum showcases an array of artifacts that narrate the stories of trade, migration, and cultural exchange throughout Asia. Particularly noteworthy are its displays of religious art, where you can admire artifacts related to Buddhism, Islam, and traditional Chinese culture. In these sections, replicas of stupas and pagodas stand as powerful symbols of spiritual heritage, drawing the eye with their detailed craftsmanship and historic significance.

From intricately carved stone sculptures to delicate porcelain, the museum showcases an array of artifacts that narrate the stories of trade, migration, and cultural exchange throughout Asia. text.text:
Step into the stories of Asia at the Asian Civilisations Museum! From ancient treasures to vibrant cultural exhibits, this place is a deep dive into the rich heritage of Singapore and beyond. Whether you're a history buff or just love cool artifacts, there's always something fascinating to explore. Bonus: It’s right by the river—perfect for a post-museum stroll! Who’s up for a visit?
Take note : Visitors are encouraged to pre-purchase their admission tickets online to reduce waiting time at the museum.
